item.title: DC visits Raichur fort to assess infrastructure needed to attract tourists
item.description:
<![CDATA[Deputy Commissioner Nitish K. inspected key heritage sites in Raichur on April 22, focusing on improving basic infrastructure at the historic Mecca Darwaza and the hilltop fort area near the city bus stand.
The Deputy Commissioner first visited Makka Darwaza to assess the possibilities for preservation and development. During the visit, he asked officials from the Raichur city corporation and the Planning Director of the Urban Development Cell to prepare a comprehensive report outlining the mea...]]>
